pygaussmarkov.CombinedSolver module¶

@author: john

class pygaussmarkov.CombinedSolver.CombinedSolver(deltaChiSqToStop=0.01, dampingFactor=1, useDampedGaussNeutonLineSearch=False, recordHistory=False)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class to solve problems of the type f(x,l) = 0. Must be implemented by a user class and the requred abstract functions implemented The code is broken down into many small functions which can allow a child class to overload any of the methods to change the performance of different methods.

computeATBPinvBTinv(AT, BPinvBTinv)[source]¶

Computes AT*BPinvBTinv AT the transpose of the determinante matrix BPinvBTinv the weight matrix return AT*BPinvBTinv

computeXhat(ATBPinvBTinvAinv, ATBPinvBTinv, w)[source]¶

Computes ATBPinvBTinvAinv * ATBPinvBTinv ATBPinvBTinvAinv = the inverse of the design matrix ATBPinvBTinv = the transpose of the determinant matrix multiplied by the weight matrix w = the residual vecotr (f(x,l)) retuns the negetive value of the update vector (ATBPinvBTinvAinv * ATBPinvBTinv).w

computerATBPinvBTinvA(ATBPinvBTinv, A)[source]¶

Computes ATBPinvBTinv*A the design matrix ATBPinvBTinv the transpose of the determinante matrix multiplied by the weight matrix A the determinant matrix return ATBPinvBTinv*A the design matrix

continueSolver(chiSq)[source]¶

Checks weather the fitter should continue for another iteration

fixParameter(name)[source]¶
freeParameter(name)[source]¶
getATBPinvBTinvAandATBPinvBTinv(variables, BpinvBTinv)[source]¶

Computes ATBPinvBTinvA and ATBPinvBTinv by calling sub functions variables = the current variables p = the weight matrix returns ATBPinvBTinvA and ATBPinvBTinv

getATBPinvBTinvAinvandATBPinvBTinvandATBPinvBTinvA(variables, BpinvBTinv)[source]¶

Computes ATBPinvBTinvAinv, ATBPinvBTinv and ATBPinvBTinvA by calling sub functions variables = the current variables p = the weight matrix returns ATBPinvBTinvAinv, ATBPinvBTinv and ATBPinvBTinvA

getAandAT(variables)[source]¶

User implemented method. Computers the determinant matrix A and its transpose AT variables = the current variables return two numpy matricies A and AT

getBandBT(variables)[source]¶

User implemented method. Computers the determinant matrix A and its transpose AT variables = the current variables return two numpy matricies A and AT

getBpinvBTinv(variables)[source]¶
getChiSq(w, BTpinvBinv)[source]¶

Computes w.p.w w = the residual vector, the difference between f(x) and the measurements returns value of w.p.w

getFixedFreeArray()[source]¶
getFreeVariables(variables)[source]¶

Returns a list of np array with only the free variables variables = np array of all the variables

return = np array of the free variables

getFxl(variables)[source]¶

User implemented method. Gets the values for the given variables. variables = the current variables return a numpy array

getListOfParameterNames()[source]¶

Returns a list of strings. There should be one entry per parameter The order should be the same as the order in the the A matrix

getNewVariables(variables, alpha, xHat)[source]¶

Combines the current variables with the update vector xHat and the scale parameter alpha The method takes account of the fixed and free variables variables = the current variables. This should inclule all the variables either free or fixed alpha the scale factor for xHat. this is a scalar value xHat the update vector. This should only include the updates for the free parameters returns the new variables vector

getNumberOfFreeParameters()[source]¶
getNumberOfParameters()[source]¶
getPinv()[source]¶

User implemented method. Gets the error matrix ((sig**2)) this is also the inverse of the weight matirx p return a single numpy matrix

getUncertaintyList(ATBPinvBTinvAInv)[source]¶

takes the inverse of the design matrix and returns a list of the the uncertainities for the parameters ATBPinvBTinvAInv is the inverse of the design matix returns a list of length number parmetrs, for the uncertainities for each parmeter. If the parameter is fixed then the value will be 0.0

getXHatandATBPinvBTinvA(variables, BpinvBTinv, w)[source]¶
newVariablesOK()[source]¶

Returns if the new variables calulated are ok. return boolean

reset()[source]¶

Resets the internal variables

runDampedGaussNewtonLineSearch(ATBPinvBTinvA, variables, xHat, chi0, BpinvBTinv, fxl)[source]¶

If useDampedGaussNeutonLineSearch is True will run a line search, else return 1 returns alpha

solve(variables)[source]¶

Method solves the model

pygaussmarkov.GaussMarkovUtilities module¶

Contains untility functions which can be used in Gaus Markov implementatinos @author: john

pygaussmarkov.GaussMarkovUtilities.generatePMatrix(errors, noMeasurements)[source]¶

Takes an error vectror and returns a diagional weight matrix. the weight is 1/error**2 errors = np list of length equal to noMeasuremetns or 1. If length =1 it will assume that this error is the same for all measurements noMeasurements = the number of measurements.

returns a diagional matrix for weights of size noMeasurements X noMeasurements

pygaussmarkov.GaussMarkovUtilities.generatePinvMatrix(errors, noMeasurements)[source]¶

Takes an error vectror and returns a diagional weight matrix. the weight is 1/error**2 errors = np list of length equal to noMeasuremetns or 1. If length =1 it will assume that this error is the same for all measurements noMeasurements = the number of measurements.

returns a diagional matrix for weights of size noMeasurements X noMeasurements

pygaussmarkov.ParametricSolver module¶

module contains the ParametricSolver object @author: john

class pygaussmarkov.ParametricSolver.ParametricSolver(deltaChiSqToStop=0.01, dampingFactor=1, useDampedGaussNeutonLineSearch=False, recordHistory=False)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class to solve problems of the type f(x) = L. Must be implemented by a user class and the requred abstract functions implemented The code is broken down into many small functions which can allow a child class to overload any of the methods to change the performance of different methods.

computeATP(AT, P)[source]¶

Computes AT*P AT the transpose of the determinante matrix P the weight matrix return AT*P

computeXhat(ATPAinv, ATP, w)[source]¶

Computes ATPAinv * ATP ATPAinv = the inverse of the design matrix ATP = the transpose of the determinant matrix multiplied by the weight matrix w = the residual vecotr (f(x)-measurements) retuns the negetive value of the update vector (ATPAinv * ATP).w

computerATPA(ATP, A)[source]¶

Computes ATP*P the design matrix ATP the transpose of the determinante matrix multiplied by the weight matrix A the determinant matrix return ATP*A the design matrix

continueSolver(chiSq)[source]¶

Checks weather the fitter should continue for another iteration

fixParameter(name)[source]¶
freeParameter(name)[source]¶
getATPAandATP(variables, p)[source]¶

Computes ATPA and ATP by calling sub functions variables = the current variables p = the weight matrix returns ATPA and ATP

getATPAinvATPandATPA(variables, p)[source]¶

Computes ATPAinv, ATP and ATPA by calling sub functions variables = the current variables p = the weight matrix returns ATPAinv, ATP and ATPA

getAandAT(variables)[source]¶

User implemented method. Computers the determinant matrix A and its transpose AT variables = the current variables return two numpy matricies A and AT

getChiSq(w, p)[source]¶

Computes w.p.w w = the residual vector, the difference between f(x) and the measurements returns value of w.p.w

getFixedFreeArray()[source]¶
getFreeVariables(variables)[source]¶

Returns a list of np array with only the free variables variables = np array of all the variables

return = np array of the free variables

getFx(variables)[source]¶

User implemented method. Gets the values for the given variables. variables = the current variables return a numpy array

getListOfParameterNames()[source]¶

Returns a list of strings. There should be one entry per parameter The order should be the same as the order in the the A matrix

getMeasurements()[source]¶

User implemented method. Gets the measurements returns a numpy array

getNewVariables(variables, alpha, xHat)[source]¶

Combines the current variables with the update vector xHat and the scale parameter alpha The method takes account of the fixed and free variables variables = the current variables. This should inclule all the variables either free or fixed alpha the scale factor for xHat. this is a scalar value xHat the update vector. This should only include the updates for the free parameters returns the new variables vector

getNumberOfFreeParameters()[source]¶
getNumberOfParameters()[source]¶
getP()[source]¶

User implemented method. Gets the weight matrix (1/(sig**2)) return a single numpy matrix

getUncertaintyList(ATPAInv)[source]¶

takes the inverse of the design matrix and returns a list of the the uncertainities for the parameters ATPAInv is the inverse of the design matix returns a list of length number parmetrs, for the uncertainities for each parmeter. If the parameter is fixed then the value will be 0.0

getW(measurements, fx)[source]¶

Computes f(x) - measurements measurements = the measurements fx = the calcualted values returns fx-measurements

getXHatandATPA(variables, p, w)[source]¶

Computes xHat by calling subfunctions. variables = the current variables p = the weight matrix w = the residual vecotr (f(x)-measurements) returns -xHat(subtract from current x to get new x), ATPAInv

newVariablesOK()[source]¶

Returns if the new variables calulated are ok. return boolean

reset()[source]¶

Resets the internal variables

runDampedGaussNewtonLineSearch(ATPA, variables, xHat, chi0, p, l, fx)[source]¶

If useDampedGaussNeutonLineSearch is True will run a line search, else return 1 returns alpha

solve(variables)[source]¶

Method solves the model
